perturbation.original_text: A. This Agreement and the provisions hereof, except as otherwise provided, shall be in full force and effect commencing on the date of execution by both Parties and shall extend for an initial term of two (2) years. This Agreement shall be automatically renewed for additional extended terms each of two (2) years duration unless either party notifies the other in writing of its intention not to renew the Agreement, such notification to be provided at least ninety (90) days prior to the expiration of the then in-effect term. The initial two (2) year term as it might be extended herein is referred to herein as the "Term."
perturbation.changed_text: A. This Agreement and the provisions hereof, except as otherwise provided, shall be in full force and effect commencing on the date of execution by both Parties and shall extend for an initial term of two (2) years. This Agreement shall be automatically renewed for additional extended terms each of two (2) years duration unless either party notifies the other in writing of its intention not to renew the Agreement, such notification to be provided at least ninety (90) days prior to the expiration of the then in-effect term. The initial two (2) year term as it might be extended herein is referred to herein as the "Term."
perturbation.explanation: Section 8(A) defines the 'Term' as the initial two-year period and any automatic two-year extensions. There is no change here, this remains the same.

perturbation.original_text: B. Notwithstanding anything in the foregoing paragraph to the contrary, with respect to each item of Current Content or Future Content the Term during which COMPANY may use and exploit same shall commence on the date hereof and continue for that period of time which is the longer of: (i) two (2) years following the date on which CONTENT PROVIDER might make full delivery of such Content to COMPANY; and (ii) the duration of the term of the license concerning that Content between CONTENT PROVIDER and its Licensor thereof.
perturbation.changed_text: B. Notwithstanding anything in the foregoing paragraph to the contrary, with respect to each item of Current Content or Future Content the Term during which COMPANY may use and exploit same shall commence on the date hereof and continue for that period of time which is the shorter of: (i) one (1) year following the date on which CONTENT PROVIDER might make full delivery of such Content to COMPANY; and (ii) half the duration of the term of the license concerning that Content between CONTENT PROVIDER and its Licensor thereof.
perturbation.explanation: Section 8(B) redefines 'Term' specifically for content usage as the *longer* of two periods related to content delivery and the licensor agreement. This directly contradicts section 8(A). Also, the duration parameters are changed to 'shorter of', 'one year' and 'half the duration'. This ambiguity creates confusion over the actual duration of the agreement and could cause legal disputes about the rights of the parties.

perturbation.original_text: A. CONTENT PROVIDER will provide to COMPANY the Content, which will comply with thedescription attached hereto as Exhibit A.
perturbation.changed_text: A. CONTENT PROVIDER will provide to COMPANY the Content, which will generally align with the description attached hereto as Exhibit A.
perturbation.explanation: This changes 'will comply' to 'will generally align', changing a hard requirement to a suggestion. This is contradicted if other sections of the contract (like warranties) assume strict adherence to Exhibit A's description.
